decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer by utilizing the Urza lands to ramp up mana production. The deck also uses disruption elements like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to control the game and protect its big threats. The inclusion of cards like Blast Zone and All Is Dust provide additional removal options, while Mazemind Tome offers card draw and lifegain. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, resilient creatures and disruptive spells to secure victory.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting opponent's game plans through counterspells and removal spells while controlling the game with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler. It aims to maintain board control with cards like Cryptic Command and Shark Typhoon, as well as generating card advantage with Snapcaster Mage. The deck also utilizes the Stoneforge Mystic package with equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine to provide additional threats and value. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to blue and white sources.

This deck capitalizes on the strategy of aggressively lowering its own life total to power up Death's Shadow and other threats, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells and removal. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence quickly and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to recover. It uses a combination of efficient creatures, disruption spells, and card selection to maintain pressure on the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers to slow down the opponent's game plan. It also includes creatures with flash and value, like Ice-Fang Coatl and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, to generate card advantage and provide defense. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage, efficient removal, and powerful threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Stoneforge Mystic. The mana base is built to support the three-color requirements while also having utility lands like Field of Ruin and Mystic Sanctuary.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands to cast Primeval Titan and generate massive value with cards like Field of the Dead and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. The key strategy involves comboing off to quickly search for and play key cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Primeval Titan. The deck also includes utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Bojuka Bog to disrupt opponent's strategies while maintaining its own game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and powerful land synergies.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and deal damage, while efficiently filling the graveyard with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Manamorphose to power up Tarmogoyf and Hooting Mandrills. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent quickly, with the option to utilize Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion for additional value.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, drawing cards, and ramping up mana using Wilderness Reclamation. It utilizes powerful spells like Cryptic Command and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value with cards like Fact or Fiction and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes key lands like Field of the Dead and Mystic Sanctuary to create additional threats and recur important spells. The overall strategy is to outvalue the opponent and eventually win through overwhelming control and efficient card advantage.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, taking advantage of low-cost spells to trigger prowess abilities and deal damage quickly. Cards like Mutagenic Growth and Lava Dart help to protect and buff creatures, while Light Up the Stage provides card advantage. The inclusion of Bedlam Reveler allows for refilling the hand with more threats. Overall, this deck focuses on maintaining pressure and tempo to close out the game as quickly as possible.

The deck revolves around using a combination of cards like Ad Nauseam, Angel's Grace, and Phyrexian Unlife to draw your entire deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. By managing resources like mana and life total carefully, the deck aims to combo off quickly and efficiently to secure a win before the opponent can disrupt the plan. The deck is designed to be consistent and resilient against disruption, with a focus on executing the combo as efficiently as possible.

This deck focuses on utilizing the suspend mechanic to cast powerful spells for free, while also disrupting your opponent's board state with the "Restore Balance" card. By suspending cards like "Crashing Footfalls" and "Ancestral Vision," you can overwhelm your opponent with creatures or card advantage. The key strategy is to cascade into "Restore Balance" with cards like "As Foretold" or "Electrodominance," effectively resetting the board in your favor. Additionally, the inclusion of counterspells and removal spells helps protect your combo pieces and maintain control of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple in order to play large Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Walking Ballista. The deck also utilizes powerful artifact cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and powerful threats, while also having the ability to control the board with cards like Blast Zone and All Is Dust.

This deck focuses on using cheap and aggressive goblin creatures to apply constant pressure on the opponent. The deck includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's resources, as well as efficient creatures like Conspicuous Snoop and Goblin Matron to maintain a strong board presence. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, while cards like Sling-Gang Lieutenant and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker provide additional reach and finishing power. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault.

The main concept of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf while disrupting their hand with spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck relies on efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to deal with threats, while also using powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to control the board. The land base is focused on maximizing the deck's consistency and mana efficiency, allowing it to execute its game plan effectively in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

The deck utilizes a combination of land ramp and control elements to efficiently bring out Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and a high number of lands, then use Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck includes cards like Opt and Growth Spiral for consistency, Lightning Bolt and Cryptic Command for removal and disruption, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath for card advantage and late-game value. Mystic Sanctuary is used to recur important spells like Cryptic Command, providing extra control options.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, while utilizing Wilderness Reclamation to generate extra mana and take multiple turns in a row. The deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan, disrupt their strategy, and ultimately out-value them with powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The mana base is optimized for flexibility and consistency, allowing the player to efficiently cast a variety of spells while maintaining control of the battlefield.

The main idea of this Gruul Utopia control deck is to utilize a combination of ramp, removal, and powerful creatures to control the pace of the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf to ramp into powerful threats like Glorybringer and Bloodbraid Elf, while disrupting the opponent with cards like Pillage and Blood Moon, the deck aims to establish board control and ultimately overwhelm the opponent with its strong creature base and removal package.
